intro: Eriogonum cithariforme, commonly known as the flaxleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, flax-like leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with branching stems that often form a dense, mat-like structure. Eriogonum cithariforme is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
